member.name: T:Netron.GraphLib.Connector
member.summary: A Connector aka 'connection point' is the spot on a shape where a line (connection) will attach itself. Lits up when cursor is nearby and can contain in/outflow data that can propagate through the connections.
member.remarks:
Things you can do:
- making the connector blink or flash when hit
- show an extensive information box when hovered
- attach a status message when hovered
- differentiate different connector on their propagation type or their parnet/child relation

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.GraphAbstract.Delete
member.summary: Deletes an element of the plex, goes via the History class, also deletes the mConnections.
member.remarks: Note that multiple mShapes can be delete in one go if they have the Selected flag set to true.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.GraphAbstract.Transmit
member.summary: This method initiates the tramsmission of data over the mConnections. It calls the tramsit method on all sub-level objects.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.GraphAbstract.Update
member.summary: Starts to update all the nodes of the plex; can be a calculation on the basis of the sent values or any other. Usually the process before all the received values are reset.
member.remarks: In normal circumstances this method goes hand-in-hand with the transmit method. Well, maybe some new physics can be invented if you hack here.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.UI.GraphControl.HitEntity(System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: This is the event handler for the mousemove and returns an entity when it hits anything from the plex. The Mouse coordinates are converted to a RectangleF of zero size and passed to all the entities in the plex. If one of the plex finds that the cursor is contained in itself then it recturns itself. This place can be used to give feedback through statusbar messages or any other info coming from the entities.
member.param: Coordinates, normally this should be the mouse coordinates.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.UI.GraphControl.HitHover(System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Pretty much the same as the HitEntity handler, it simply checks if the HitEntity returns something different than the previous hit. If it is something different than the previous hit it sets the internal 'Hover' entity to the new one.
member.param: In normal circumstances this should be the mouse coordinates.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.UI.GraphControl.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides the paint method and calls the paint method of the extract structure which will loop through all the shapes, connections and connectors. Two other objects need attention here. One is an eventual shape just created and hanging at the cursor. The other is a connection fixed on a shape on one end but hanging at the cursor on the other (not attached yet). These two are painted separately.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.UI.GraphControl.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the plex to the selected path using the wonderful .Net serialization.

remarks.br: Would it be possible to save all this to a database?
You can also use the XML or SOAP serialization but note that only public methods and properties will be serialized, not sure the plex will be allright on deserialization.

member.param: The path to which to save the data.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.Analysis.Algorithms.KruskalsAlgorithm(Netron.GraphLib.Analysis.IGraph)
member.summary: Kruskal's algorithm is an algorithm that finds a minimum spanning tree for a connected weighted graph. This means it finds a subset of the edges that forms a tree that includes every vertex, where the total weight of all the edges in the tree is minimized. If the graph is not connected, then it finds a minimum spanning forest (a minimum spanning tree for each connected component).

member.summary: Creates a random number generator using the time of day in milliseconds as the seed.

member.summary: Gets the maximum random integer value. All random integers generated by instances of this class are less than or equal to this value. This value is 0x7fffffff (2,147,483,647).

member.summary: Returns a random integer greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to MaxRandomInt.

member.summary: Returns a positive random integer less than the specified maximum.
member.param: The maximum value. Must be greater than zero.
member.returns: A positive random integer less than or equal to maxValue.

member.summary: Returns a random integer within the specified range.
member.returns: A random integer greater than or equal to minValue, and less than or equal to maxValue.

member.returns: A single-precision floating point number greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.Maths.MersenneTwister.NextFloat(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a random number greater than or equal to zero, and either strictly less than one, or less than or equal to one, depending on the value of the given boolean parameter.
member.param: If true, the random number returned will be less than or equal to one; otherwise, the random number returned will be strictly less than one.
member.returns: If includeOne is true, this method returns a single-precision random number greater than or equal to zero, and less than or equal to one. If includeOne is false, this method returns a single-precision random number greater than or equal to zero and strictly less than one.

member.name: M:Netron.GraphLib.Maths.MersenneTwister.NextFloatPositive
member.summary: Returns a random number greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0.
member.returns: A random number greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0.

member.summary: Returns a random number between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.summary: Returns a random number greater than or equal to zero, and either strictly less than one, or less than or equal to one, depending on the value of the given boolean parameter.

member.summary: Returns a random number greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0.
member.returns: A random number greater than 0.0 and less than 1.0.

member.name: T:Netron.GraphLib.PropertyBag
member.summary:
Represents a collection of custom properties that can be selected into a PropertyGrid to provide functionality beyond that of the simple reflection normally used to query an object's properties.
Thanks to Tony Allowatt for this code http://www.codeproject.com/cs/miscctrl/bending_property.asp http://codeproject.com/vb/net/Propertygrid_Editor.asp

member.summary: Copies the entire PropertySpecCollection to a compatible one-dimensional Array, starting at the beginning of the target array.
